timeline.message:
NF: Remove useless code

Putting back the array is useless, since it has been modified.

Removing it help changing the next commits of this PR

timeline.bodyText: This changes functionality if ja has more than 2 elements.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
ja is never supposed to have more than two elements. If ja has more than two elements there is a bigger problem, which is that the json was broke somewhere. Normally, ja is a pair, not a list.
According to our wiki:

newToday/revToday/lrnToday : two number array.
First one is the number of days that have passed between the collection was created and the deck was last updated
The second one is equal to the number of cards seen today in this deck minus the number of new cards in custom study today.
BEWARE, it's changed in anki.sched(v2).Scheduler._updateStats and anki.sched(v2).Scheduler._updateCutoff.update  but can't be found by grepping 'newToday', because it's instead written as type+"Today" with type which may be new/rev/lrnToday
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText:
Do you feel "replace", or "keep the other values" will be better for backwards compatibility?
If we're using the Array as an Object (index -> property), then we'd be best to keep the other values and this change is correct.
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I can't easily imagine why we would want to delete a third value if it was introduced. It would not be read anywhere in our code, and any other code which would introduce such a value should probably be made assuming the third value may or may not disappear
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior
